definitions.definition: One who makes a tick mark.
A measuring or reporting device, particularly one which makes a ticking sound as the measured events occur.
examples: The ticker was showing an increased rate of flow.

definitions.definition: A ticker tape , either the traditional paper kind or a scrolling message on a screen.
examples: I checked the prices on the ticker one last time before placing the trade.
To my surprise, the ticker showed that the deal had already gone through.

definitions.definition: A heart, especially a human one.
examples: My ticker gave out and I had to go to the hospital for surgery.

definitions.definition: A birdwatcher who aims to see (and tick off on a list) as many bird species as possible.
A beer drinker who aims to try as many different beers as possible and keeps a record of all the beers they have drunk.

main_definition: One who makes a tick mark.
secondary_definitions: A measuring or reporting device, particularly one which makes a ticking sound as the measured events occur.
A ticker tape , either the traditional paper kind or a scrolling message on a screen.
( slang ) A heart, especially a human one.
( birdwatching , slang ) A birdwatcher who aims to see (and tick off on a list) as many bird species as possible.
A beer drinker who aims to try as many different beers as possible and keeps a record of all the beers they have drunk.
